document.docAuthor: Liang, Ai-Ping, Jiang, Guo-Mei & Webb, M. D.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Oriental spittlebug genera Baibarana Matsumura and Telogmometopius Jacobi (Hemiptera: Cercopidae: Rhinaulacini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Oriental spittlebug genera Baibarana Matsumura and Telogmometopius Jacobi (Hemiptera: Cercopidae: Rhinaulacini)

paragraph.heading:
Key to the species of
Telogmometopius

paragraph.keyLead:
2. Postclypeus with lower two-thirds of median keel distinctly dilated laterally resulting in a diamond-shaped, flattened, median area; subgenital plates ( Figure 71 ) with apical spine-like process distinctly longer than expanded basal region; India ...............
bicarinatus
sp. nov.

caption.paragraph:
Figures 69–82.
Telogmometopius species
, male genitalia, left lateral view except where indicated. (69–73)
T. bicarinatus
: (69) male genital capsule, ventral view; (70) male genital capsule; (71) subgenital plate, ventrolateral view; (72) left genital style; (73) left genital style, inner side view. (74–79)
T. carinilabratus
: (74) male genital capsule, ventral view; (75) male genital capsule; (76) subgenital plate, ventral view; (77) lateral plate; (78) genital style; (79) aedeagus. (80–82)
T. himalayensis
: (80) male genital capsule, ventral view; (81) male genital capsule; (82) subgenital plate, ventral view.

Figures 83–93.
Telogmometopius species
, male genitalia, left lateral view except where indicated. (83–85)
T. bifasciatus
: (83) male genital capsule; (84) subgenital plate, ventrolateral view; (85) aedeagus. (86–90)
T. rangoonensis
: (86) male genital capsule, ventral view; (87) male genital capsule; (88) subgenital plate, ventrolateral view; (89) lateral plate; (90) genital style. (91–93)
T. angulatus
: (91) male genital capsule, ventral view; (92) male genital capsule; (93) subgenital plate.

materialsCitation.keyLead:
3. Length „ 7.5–8.4 mm, ♀ 7.5–8.5 mm; subgenital plates ( Figure 74 ) joined basally in ventral view; aedeagal shaft ( Figure 79 ) with apical process coiled; SW China ( Yunnan , Tibet )..........
carinilabratus (Chou and Wu)

paragraph.keyLead:
–
Length „ 5.4–5.5 mm, ♀ 5.6 mm; subgenital plates ( Figure 80 ) slightly separated in ventral view; aedeagal shaft ( Figure 81 ) with apical process sinuate; NE India ( E Himalayas ), SW China ( Tibet ).........
himalayensis
sp. nov
.
– Fore wings without transverse fuscous fasciae........... 5

5. Subgenital plates ( Figures 91–93 ) with expanded basal region very elongate and apical spine-like process short, stout, and dorsally directed in lateral view, not visible in ventral view; northern Borneo.......
angulatus
sp. nov.

– Subgenital plates ( Figures 88 , 95, 100 ) with expanded basal region and apical spine-like process abruptly differentiated in ventral view; apical spine-like process fine or stout..................... 7

7. Subgenital plates ( Figure 88 ) with apical spine-like process much longer than expanded basal region; Burma .........
rangoonensis
sp. nov.

materialsCitation.keyLead:
8. Subgenital plates ( Figure 100 ) with apical spine-like process fine; aedeagal shaft ( Figure 103 ) similar in width distally in lateral view, subapical process relatively short; southern and central China ( Hubei , Gansu , Sichuan , Guizhou ,? Jiangxi )..................
obsoletus Jacobi
